page.title: 17SIDDINGTON'S GARDEN CENTRE
page.content: The family firm which owns the King's Meadow Garden Centre was founded in 1795.Through the founder's 4 sons the business diversified.The Seed Section became this centre.The main building on the 2.5 acre site is a double green house with 500m2 of selling area.Here sprays,fertilizers,tools,house plants and garden items are sold.Outside in the garden proper plants,trees,shrubs, paving,fencing,green houses,sheds and swimming pools are sold.The busiest times of the year are Spring for planting flowers and Autumn for bulbs. The centre is open 7 days a week and the customers,2,000 per week,are often in the 25-45 age group.The stock,which is bought in from specialist growers, is often bulky so a car park for 80 cars is provided.An adventure play ground and mini zoo are planned for a 6 acre site to the west of the centre.
